results.content: I was hoping to learn something new from this course, despite already knowing some CSS animations. I've seen some amazing things online, but felt like I didn't know what I was missing to get there. Unfortunately, this course not only didn't teach me anything new, but it also didn't cover a lot of the CSS animations I already knew how to do. The bulk of this class covers using stroke-dasharray and stroke-dashoffset. While a cool trick, it's a one trick pony and every project was too simple to feel like any achievement.
results.content_html: I was hoping to learn something new from this course, despite already knowing some CSS animations. I've seen some amazing things online, but felt like I didn't know what I was missing to get there. Unfortunately, this course not only didn't teach me anything new, but it also didn't cover a lot of the CSS animations I already knew how to do. The bulk of this class covers using stroke-dasharray and stroke-dashoffset. While a cool trick, it's a one trick pony and every project was too simple to feel like any achievement.

results.content:
This could be a really good course if the author would have put a little more effort into it. What do I refer to? In all the examples we guessed the length of the SVG elements. Maybe closing the JS-window in codepen first is not a good idea as one could figure out the exact properties. Even better: one can SET the length of the element manually so that you can influence the exact behaviour of the animation. The rotating diamond for example can be animated so that the inner and outer polygon are finished together. Or if you want an offset, you can choose this offset. Chosing a bigger value than necessary for the dasharray results in other animation times than specified.



Do I recommend this course? Yes, because I didn't find a better alternative here.

Is it enough to enroll to be happy? No. But doing some research and fixing the flaws of the content improves self-guided learning.
results.content_html:
This could be a really good course if the author would have put a little more effort into it. What do I refer to? In all the examples we guessed the length of the SVG elements. Maybe closing the JS-window in codepen first is not a good idea as one could figure out the exact properties. Even better: one can SET the length of the element manually so that you can influence the exact behaviour of the animation. The rotating diamond for example can be animated so that the inner and outer polygon are finished together. Or if you want an offset, you can choose this offset. Chosing a bigger value than necessary for the dasharray results in other animation times than specified.

Do I recommend this course? Yes, because I didn't find a better alternative here.

Is it enough to enroll to be happy? No. But doing some research and fixing the flaws of the content improves self-guided learning.

PLEASE UPDATE THIS COURSE.

results.content:
Easy learning through examples.
The SVG images he uses were created using ADOBE.  The files are available for download.

INKSCAPE USERS:
For those wanting to use Inkscape (which is what I used), I recommend saving in PLAIN SVG format.  For the coding done in CSS to work, you will need to remove the similar code which is present in the text you paste under the HTML section.  If this is not done, the HTML code will override what you enter under the CSS section.
results.content_html:
Easy learning through examples.
The SVG images he uses were created using ADOBE. The files are available for download.

INKSCAPE USERS:
For those wanting to use Inkscape (which is what I used), I recommend saving in PLAIN SVG format. For the coding done in CSS to work, you will need to remove the similar code which is present in the text you paste under the HTML section. If this is not done, the HTML code will override what you enter under the CSS section.

results.content:
The instructor was clear and informative and examples were enjoyable to work through. Production quality was great.

I would have liked to have seen even one or two extra examples involving more complex techniques, but the techniques taught in the course can be used to create more complicated animations with some practice.
results.content_html:
The instructor was clear and informative and examples were enjoyable to work through. Production quality was great.

results.content: Fantastic course! I have very very basic HTML, CSS, and JS experience and this course provides a straightforward explanation of some great animation options that does not exceed my current skillset. You don't need to have years of website design experience to pick up SVG animation, and this course proves it. Minor suggestion, Adobe Illustrator has been updated so there are some subtle changes between the version used in this course and the new version, but otherwise, no problems at all.
results.content_html: Fantastic course! Minor suggestion, Adobe Illustrator has been updated so there are some subtle changes between the version used in this course and the new version, but otherwise, no problems at all.

results.content:
Great introduction to SVG and CSS Animation. If you know a bit of CSS and HTML already, learning to work with SVGs really expands your toolkit. If you're new to CSS, it's still an accessible way to put CSS into context without being too advanced.

Instructor was clear and straightforward. I appreciated that the course was tight.
results.content_html:
Great introduction to SVG and CSS Animation. If you know a bit of CSS and HTML already, learning to work with SVGs really expands your toolkit. If you're new to CSS, it's still an accessible way to put CSS into context without being too advanced.

Instructor was clear and straightforward. I appreciated that the course was tight.

results.content:
Perfect and well explained introduction to svg animation. The author is  perfectly understandable, speaks with a normal speed and has a nice building up towards the end animation. In short: it is a course to consider! 
There are, however, some drawbacks. As someone else already mentioned: svg does not work in edge, there is no explanation given or perhaps a lecture about the alternatives to svg. That would really finish the course.
results.content_html:
Perfect and well explained introduction to svg animation. The author is perfectly understandable, speaks with a normal speed and has a nice building up towards the end animation. In short: it is a course to consider!
There are, however, some drawbacks. As someone else already mentioned: svg does not work in edge, there is no explanation given or perhaps a lecture about the alternatives to svg. That would really finish the course.

results.content:
I can't believe this is offered as a free course.
The author covers all the bases, from creating an svg image in Illustrator to styling it in Codepen, then implementing it on a website. Also showcases many transform/style properties and shows many examples.
Great course.
results.content_html:
I can't believe this is offered as a free course.
The author covers all the bases, from creating an svg image in Illustrator to styling it in Codepen, then implementing it on a website. Also showcases many transform/style properties and shows many examples.
Great course.

results.content: The course is not maintained and questions left unanswered. There are some basics of SVG and CSS3 animations but examples are not cross browser compatible. There are libraries which provide cross browser compatibility and can be used to acomplish similar animations but author didn't even mention them. Save your money and search tutorials on YouTube. This course would be good as a free tutorial but it is not good enough for paid one.
results.content_html: The course is not maintained and questions left unanswered. There are some basics of SVG and CSS3 animations but examples are not cross browser compatible. There are libraries which provide cross browser compatibility and can be used to acomplish similar animations but author didn't even mention them. Save your money and search tutorials on YouTube. This course would be good as a free tutorial but it is not good enough for paid one.

Im glad I took this course, it was fun and gave an interesting skill to add to my web programing.

results.content: I really enjoyed the class. Using Codepen is a great idea, providing the source SVG made it really quick to start and tweak projects without having to download any tools. Much easier to code all the examples and get more out of the class.

results.content:
I really liked that the course was easy to follow and that it built upon its self. Often you would repeat things but this was rather an advantage as it helped in recalling which code does what. 

So many other teachers will show a technique once and then never mention it again.

My only negative point would be that there was not too much actual content. I am not complaining. I set out to learn SVG animation, I did that - though it would have been nice to see more advanced things towards the end.

results.content: I really enjoyed this course.  One thing that is important to note is that all the svg resources are in compressed files, so to use those resources you will need to unzip them first to access the svg files inside.

results.content: Great course to give you a beginners insight into SVG animation! Even if you are comfortable with HTML and CSS working with SVGs for the first time I would recommend doing this course. I am now moving onto the the next course code_collective provides (Learn SVG Animation - With HTML, CSS & Javascript) really excited
results.content_html: Great course to give you a beginners insight into SVG animation! Even if you are comfortable with HTML and CSS working with SVGs for the first time I would recommend doing this course. I am now moving onto the the next course code_collective provides (Learn SVG Animation - With HTML, CSS & Javascript) really excited

results.content:
This is a great course for anyone that wants step-by-step instructions w/ examples. It walks you through using Adobe Illustrator and then uses codepen to quickly apply the animation techniques from the lesson. 

My only complaint is that I wish the creator suggested an alternative to Adobe Illustrator as AI is fairly expensive. My recommendation for Mac (or at least what I've used to practice on my own) is Sketch.
results.content_html:
This is a great course for anyone that wants step-by-step instructions w/ examples. It walks you through using Adobe Illustrator and then uses codepen to quickly apply the animation techniques from the lesson.

My only complaint is that I wish the creator suggested an alternative to Adobe Illustrator as AI is fairly expensive. My recommendation for Mac (or at least what I've used to practice on my own) is Sketch.

results.content: It's literally the same example over and over again. You don't learn much after the first time. I only rated it this high because the instructor presents it well.
results.content_html: It's literally the same example over and over again. You don't learn much after the first time. I only rated it this high because the instructor presents it well.

results.content: Great course. Well explained and easy to follow! Could maybe have shown more diverse techniques, but overall very pleased with this course! Great introduction. And great that it included a small part on how to actually implement it.
results.content_html: Great course. Well explained and easy to follow! Could maybe have shown more diverse techniques, but overall very pleased with this course! Great introduction. And great that it included a small part on how to actually implement it.

results.content: Well paced, just enough repetition to cement practice and ideas. Well spoken and great for beginning with the topic. Good. Not for advanced users, but certainly excellent for the intended audience. I think he could include some learning resources for reading/research and maybe an optional section going into details behind the 'magic', but overall am happy with the purchase and content.
results.content_html: Well paced, just enough repetition to cement practice and ideas. Well spoken and great for beginning with the topic. Good. Not for advanced users, but certainly excellent for the intended audience. I think he could include some learning resources for reading/research and maybe an optional section going into details behind the 'magic', but overall am happy with the purchase and content.

results.content: Nice and short introduction to css animations. But also a lot of redundant things, like positioning or path animation, which is the same procedure at all of his examples. At least – if you do all the examples – you'll get some practice.
results.content_html: Nice and short introduction to css animations. But also a lot of redundant things, like positioning or path animation, which is the same procedure at all of his examples. At least – if you do all the examples – you'll get some practice.

results.content: It teaches the basic, I can develop varios animation from this. It's short, I believe the price should be smaller, but I can't deny that I have tools to animate svgs now.
results.content_html: It teaches the basic, I can develop varios animation from this. It's short, I believe the price should be smaller, but I can't deny that I have tools to animate svgs now.

results.content: This course is well-structured and easy to follow. The instructor does a great job of explaining how to complete each step and as well as why they are needed.
results.content_html: This course is well-structured and easy to follow. The instructor does a great job of explaining how to complete each step and as well as why they are needed.

results.content: Good introduction to SVG animations. Good clear explanations of each example and providing SVG code for several elements was very helpful.
results.content_html: Good introduction to SVG animations. Good clear explanations of each example and providing SVG code for several elements was very helpful.

results.content: It was a very helpful short course to understand the animation using SVG and CSS. It would be great if there is content about the animation using JS as well, such as start/stop animation based on ​user actions.
results.content_html: It was a very helpful short course to understand the animation using SVG and CSS. It would be great if there is content about the animation using JS as well, such as start/stop animation based on ​user actions.

results.content:
I enjoyed the course. While it's basic, you have to start somewhere. I feel confident exporting SVG's from my vector editor (Affinity) to CodePen, manipulating them and incorporating them into web projects.

The only reason I gave it 4.5 stars rather than 5 was a desire for more projects and exploration of additional SVG attributes (e.g. targetX, clip-path, etc.). But still, great instruction and fun course to start your SVG journey with.
results.content_html:
I enjoyed the course. While it's basic, you have to start somewhere. I feel confident exporting SVG's from my vector editor (Affinity) to CodePen, manipulating them and incorporating them into web projects.

The only reason I gave it 4.5 stars rather than 5 was a desire for more projects and exploration of additional SVG attributes (e.g. targetX, clip-path, etc.). But still, great instruction and fun course to start your SVG journey with.

results.content: fairly quick short lessons that just deal with the issue, no fluff, works well as a quick refresher or reminder on how to do something particular, would ahve been nice if there were more examples and a build up to a bigger complex animation. results.content:
It's a great course for beginners and for people, who just want to improve their knowledge.
Good explanation, good examples. But fix please an issue with SVG, 'cause it's really uncomfortable.

results.content: This course takes 1.5 hours to explain something that takes 5 minutes. All of the examples use the same technique (that you can Google in 3 minutes), plus each one has a few extra lines of code doing something mundane like changing opacity or rotating an object. This course is called "SVG animation", not "CSS basics". It was a waste of time for me. It's for total beginers - those who never opened Illustrator or a code editor. Sorry.
results.content_html: This course takes 1.5 hours to explain something that takes 5 minutes. All of the examples use the same technique (that you can Google in 3 minutes), plus each one has a few extra lines of code doing something mundane like changing opacity or rotating an object. This course is called "SVG animation", not "CSS basics". It was a waste of time for me. It's for total beginers - those who never opened Illustrator or a code editor. Sorry.

results.content:
Very informative and instructive course on how to animate SVG. Does not presume that you know anything, but instead walks you through each of the properties.

SVG is getting more and more popular on the web, especially mobile because it can be scaled to any size without increasing the actual file size.

Highly recommended.
results.content_html:
Very informative and instructive course on how to animate SVG. Does not presume that you know anything, but instead walks you through each of the properties.

SVG is getting more and more popular on the web, especially mobile because it can be scaled to any size without increasing the actual file size.

Highly recommended.

results.content: Great course, thank you! Quick to catch and gave lots of great info. Looking forward to exploring more animation options!

results.content: A price tag of $40 for this course is just silly.  It has 3 or 4 examples of basically 2 or 3 different animation concepts with CSS.  Luckily I got this on sale for $10.
